attributes.title: False Positives Interpretation
attributes.visState:
{"title":"False Positives Interpretation","type":"markdown","params":{"fontSize":12,"markdown":"# Interpretation
Graphs below display total number of unique IPs hitting particular signature or violation at a moment of time. A spike on any of them means that lots of clients trigger the same rule which likely means policy misconfiguration which causes false positives.

**NORMAL: Low and steady**

**ABNORMAL: High or Spikes**
#### What to do if you suspect false positives?
Identify top signatures or/and violations from graphs and adjust policy configuration to make them fire on suspicious events only.","openLinksInNewTab":false},"aggs":[]}

attributes.title: Rate of Unique IPs per Violation
attributes.visState: {"title":"Rate of Unique IPs per Violation","type":"timelion","params":{"expression":".es(index=waf-logs-*, split=violations.keyword:10, metric=cardinality:ip_client.keyword,q='NOT violations:\"N/A\"').label(\"\n$1\", \"^.*:(.*) >.*\"),.es(index=waf-logs-*, metric=cardinality:ip_client.keyword).label(\"Total source IPs\"),","interval":"auto"},"aggs":[]}

attributes.title: Rate of Unique IPs per Signature
attributes.visState: {"title":"Rate of Unique IPs per Signature","type":"timelion","params":{"expression":".es(index=waf-logs-*, split=sig_ids.keyword:10, metric=cardinality:ip_client.keyword, q='NOT sig_ids:\"N/A\"').label(\"$1\", \"^.*:(.*) >.*\"),.es(index=waf-logs-*, metric=cardinality:ip_client.keyword).label(\"Total source IPs\"),","interval":"auto"},"aggs":[]}
